Title: StartComp
Description: Windows Start Menu Companion is a tool that helps you all day. Launch applications and control panel items, explore your drives, read feeds and keep notes.
HomeWiki:
Windows Start Menu Companion is a tool that helps you all-day, every day. You can add links for your applications to the provided or self defined repositories and run them from there with command line argument support. Exploring your drives, launching windows control panel items, reading feeds and last but not least keeping notes is all packed into one single piece of free software.

This is the beta version which is currently under development. Most of the desired features have already been implemented. The beta is mostly about finding bugs and enhancing the user experience. All released versions are stable for everyday use. The full version will be released "when it's done", but development has gone strong the last months.

Information on how about to use StartComp is available in the documentation.
You can find the current release notes at the downloads page or read the complete history.
Please report any found bugs using the issue tracker.

Prerequisites: .NET Framework 4 Client Profile
Supported Platforms: Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8
